definitions: A localized balloon-like dilation of the aorta, the main artery that carries blood from the heart to the rest of the body. It can be caused by a weakening of the aortic wall due to various factors such as atherosclerosis, high blood pressure, or genetic conditions.
examples: The patient was diagnosed with an aortic aneurysm after a routine check-up.
Rupture of an aortic aneurysm is a life-threatening emergency.
Regular monitoring is crucial for managing an aortic aneurysm.
